Collaborate and work closely with the Dealing, Product and Treasury to develop the right opportunities and capabilities.

We are looking for an individual with drive and passion that is eager to help us take Ebury to the next level.

Experience: 1 year as an FX trader managing a book or in dealing support execution roles in a fintech or bank.

Strong communication skills and an ability to build and leverage cross-functional relationships. High level of English.

The Finance team is responsible for maintaining proper accounting records both locally and at a Group level, including internal and external IFRS and local GAAP reporting, as well as reporting to the parent company, Santander. Support as needed on audit-related activities for subsidiaries of the group, managing coordination of auditor requests and ensuring adherence to deadlines 
Participate in accounting functions, performing the calculations and bookings as part of month-end close
Develop and maintain complex excel spreadsheets to support reporting and accounting tasks
Support the development of a culture of ownership and accountability for identifying and initiating change that will improve processes, controls, and systems
Proactively engage with all functional areas across Eburys global operations, and external parties, undertaking an analytical review of processes, ensuring appropriate controls are in place and advising on improvements and efficiencies to provide timely reporting to external parties.

Finance professional with at least 4 years of relevant experience
Advanced proficiency in Excel and data analysis
IFRS knowledge is required.
Exceptional communication skills in Spanish and English required.
Excellent analytical, decision-making, and problem-solving skills.
Strong attention to detail and ability to work with large amounts of data without compromising accuracy.
Proven ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple projects with tight deadlines.
